str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
Simon. Of Hebrew origin; Simon, the name of nine Israelites.
Peter, a Greek name meaning rock. Apparently a primary word; a rock; as a name, Petrus, an apostle.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From pros and pipto; to fall towards, i.e. prostrate oneself, or to rush upon.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
The knee. Of uncertain affinity; the 'knee'.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To go out, come out. From ek and erchomai; to issue.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Sinning, sinful, depraved, detestable. From hamartano; sinful, i.e. A sinner.
A male human being; a man, husband. A primary word; a man.
